description: A staple food prepared from a dough of flour and water, usually by baking.
The starchy seeds of a cereal grass that are cooked and used for food.
A dish originally from Italy consisting of dough made from durum wheat and water, extruded or stamped into various shapes.
A food derived from milk that is produced in a wide range of flavors, textures, and forms by coagulation of the milk protein casein.
A dairy product made by churning fresh or fermented cream or milk.
An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, often eaten as food.
The flesh of a chicken used as food.
The flesh of a cow, bull, or ox, used as food.
The flesh of fish used as food.
The flesh of a young sheep used as food.
A round fruit with red, green, or yellow skin and crisp flesh.
A long curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft sweet flesh.
A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind.
A sweet soft red fruit with a seed-studded surface.
A food preparation in the form of a paste or solid block made from roasted and ground cacao seeds.
An item of soft sweet food made from a mixture of flour, fat, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients, baked and sometimes iced or decorated.
A small sweet cake, typically round, flat, and crisp.
A sweet frozen food made from dairy products, such as milk and cream, combined with flavorings and sweeteners.
A dish of Italian origin consisting of a flat, round base of dough baked with a topping of tomato sauce and cheese.
A round patty of ground beef, fried or grilled and typically served on a bun or roll.
A cold dish of various mixtures of raw or cooked vegetables, usually seasoned with oil, vinegar, or other dressing.
A liquid dish, typically made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables, etc., in stock or water.
An item of food consisting of two pieces of bread with meat, cheese, or other filling between them.
A Japanese dish consisting of small balls or rolls of vinegar-flavored cold rice served with a garnish of raw fish, vegetables, or egg.
A slice of meat, typically beef, usually cooked by grilling or frying.
A dish of pieces of meat, fish, or vegetables roasted or grilled on a skewer or spit.
A semi-solid food prepared from milk fermented by added bacteria.
A sweet, sticky, yellowish-brown fluid made by bees from nectar collected from flowers.
A sweet spread or preserve made from fruit and sugar boiled to a thick consistency.
A liquid fat obtained from olives, used in cooking and salad dressings.
A sour-tasting liquid containing acetic acid, obtained by fermenting dilute alcoholic liquids.
A white crystalline substance that gives seawater its characteristic taste.
A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugar cane and sugar beet.
A powder obtained by grinding grain, typically wheat, and used to make bread, cakes, and pastry.
A strip, ring, or tube of pasta or a similar dough, typically made with egg and usually eaten with a sauce or in a soup.
A paste made from ground, dry-roasted peanuts.
A type of corn that expands from the kernel and puffs up when heated.
A thin, flat cake of batter, fried on both sides in a pan and typically rolled up with a sweet or savory filling.
A dish of beaten eggs cooked in a frying pan until firm, often with a filling added.
A grain used for food, such as wheat, oats, or corn.
